events.title: First Nobel Prize Award Ceremony
events.description: The first Nobel Prize award ceremony was held in Stockholm, Sweden, honoring recipients for achievements in physics, chemistry, medicine, literature, and peace.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of one of the most prestigious global awards recognizing outstanding contributions to humanity.

events.title: Adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly adopted the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, a milestone document outlining fundamental human rights to be universally protected.
events.significance: Established a common standard for human rights worldwide, influencing international law and human rights movements.

events.description: Alfred Nobel, the Swedish inventor of dynamite and philanthropist, passed away, leaving his fortune to establish the Nobel Prize.
events.significance: His bequest led to the creation of the Nobel Prizes, which have had a lasting impact on recognizing achievements across disciplines.

events.title: First African Female Astronaut to Go to Space
events.description: Wang Yaping, a Chinese astronaut, became the first Chinese woman to conduct a spacewalk during the Shenzhou 13 mission.
events.significance: Marked a notable milestone for women in space exploration and China's advancing space program.
